definition: ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine

sentences.english: With stimulants in particular, like meth and cocaine, they suppress the appetite.
sentences.chinese: 成瘾性药物，例如冰毒和可卡因，可以破坏食欲。

sentences.english: I recalled an article that mentioned these were symptoms of crystal meth abuse.
sentences.chinese: 我记起曾有一篇文章说道这些是冰毒滥用的症状。

sentences.english: In ballroom ice drove youth to wild dancing.
sentences.chinese: 迪厅的年轻人在冰毒的作用下正群魔乱舞。

sentences.english: A big problem for some people taking methamphetamines is eating properly.
sentences.chinese: 另外一部分冰毒成瘾人群尚能正常饮食。

sentences.english: He later told investigators the drugs were for his personal use, according to the local police department .
sentences.chinese: 高相在接受调查时表示，“持有冰毒是为了自己用”。

sentences.english: His drinking problem led him to cocaine, and then to crystal meth.
sentences.chinese: 他的酒瘾导致了他使用可卡因，之后开始服用冰毒。

sentences.english: Later, she admitted that she also gave him crystal meth.
sentences.chinese: 后来，那个人质承认她还给了该男子冰毒。

definition: to track down and seize (a criminal suspect, contraband etc)
cocaine (loanword)/also written 可卡因[ke3 ka3 yin1]
